intro: Textoria protea, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by spherical, woody fruits. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in dry, arid environments. Textoria protea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
